title: 2018 Estonian Small Cup
text:
The 2018 <a href="Estonian%20Small%20Cup">Estonian Small Cup</a> was the 9th season of the <a href="Estonia">Estonia</a>n amateur <a href="Football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> knockout tournament. The tournament began in March 2018, and the final took place in September 2018 at the <a href="A.%20Le%20Coq%20Arena">A. Le Coq Arena</a>, Tallinn. <a href="Paide%20Linnameeskond%20III">Paide Linnameeskond III</a> were the defending champions.
<a href="Saue%20JK">Saue JK</a> won the cup after beating <a href="Raasiku%20FC%20Joker">Raasiku FC Joker</a> 2–0 in the final.
First Round (1/64).
The draw was made by <a href="Estonian%20Football%20Association">Estonian Football Association</a> on 9 March 2018.
Byes.
These teams were not drawn and secured a place in the second round without playing:
Second Round (1/32).
The draw was made by <a href="Estonian%20Football%20Association">Estonian Football Association</a> on 2 April 2018.
Third Round (1/16).
The draw was made by <a href="Estonian%20Football%20Association">Estonian Football Association</a> on 26 April 2018.
Fourth Round (1/8).
The draw was made by <a href="Estonian%20Football%20Association">Estonian Football Association</a> on 23 May 2018.
Quarter-finals.
The draw was made on 15 June 2018.
Semi-finals.
The draw was made on 2 August 2018.
Final.
The two finalist were Saue JK, who reached quarter-finals the previous season, and Raasiku FC Joker, who enjoyed third-tier football last year. Both teams are from <a href="Harju%20County">Harju County</a>.
